expands.title: Why don't you have more stuff on GitHub?
expands.content: I've been a selfish prick most of my life. Only in the past few years have I taken a hard swing toward socialism. And therefore, most of my work I've kept proprietary because of that selfishness. and now, I simply don't like coding enough to

expands.title: What are the downsides of working with you?
Will you work for equity?
expands.content:
Yes! And frankly, I find it a little telling that most freelancers and consultants *won't* work for equity.

Given that Iâ€™m a risk-tolerant guy with ultra low expenses and zero dependents... there are only three reasons why I wouldn't accept equity.

1. I don't believe in your project's mission.
2. I don't believe in your project's ability to make money.
3. I don't believe in you or your team.

In all three of those cases... I should say no to your project. Right?

So, yeah, I'm happy to put ~~my~~ your money where my mouth is. I need to be paid a minimum of $2,500/month in cash to pay my bills (plus a little buffer), but am happy to accept some or all of the remaining payment in the form of equity.
